content: The traditional attire worn during the Diwali festival varies depending on the region and culture. In northern India, women typically wear colorful sarees or salwar-kameez, while men wear kurta pyjamas or sherwanis. In southern India, women wear silk sarees, while men wear dhotis with silk or cotton shirts. In some parts of the country, people also wear traditional jewelry, such as bangles and earrings, during the festival.
